Our Field Teams are prepared to take action wherever it is needed & have been training to make sure they are ready to respond this winter.

tweets.text:
This week is #FloodSafetyWeek. 

Although there is no forecast for imminent heavy rain, as we enter winter it's a good idea to know the risks.

Did you know just 30cm of flowing water can move your car?

Follow @EnvAgency for more. https://t.co/MS2K5Xws1F

It's #FloodActionWeek!

Make it your aim to know what to do in a flood to keep yourself and the things you love safe.

üëâLearn what to do in a flood: https://t.co/yDrqZN037T

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/i10cYZkcUj

Today we launched a ¬£200m programme to improve the resilience of communities at risk of #flooding & coastal change. 

25 areas will be selected to receive funding to demonstrate how innovative actions can work, individually and in combination.

Read more https://t.co/Jr6aN8afJ0 https://t.co/m2XzBkSPHP
@EnvAgency @CheshireEast I am building an ark. Another ten years before it's finished.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Great Canal Journeys
entity.description: Prunella Scales and Timothy West embark on canal journeys together, traversing the canals of the UK, Europe, and the rest of the world by canal barge and narrowboat. Their trips take them along many scenic waterways, including ancient routes followed by the Vikings in Sweden, the windmills along the canals near Amsterdam, and the route once taken by Casanova in Venice. Along the way they interact with interesting characters, taste regional dishes and explore the sights around the canals. Sheila Hancock and Gyles Brandreth host the twelfth season.

tweets.text:
#GreatCanalJourneys is back

Watch funny and charming hosts #SheilaHancock and @gylesb1 travel the upper #RiverThames

Look out for Thames Harbour Master Barry Russell: https://t.co/Z0s8le8ObW

More about our support for boaters: https://t.co/bhDKmh6t0u
Pic:@spungoldtv-Channel 4 https://t.co/sBFs1SJw9J

Today marks the start of @EnvAgency's #FloodActionWeek 

Would you know what to do in a flood? Taking action before a flood could keep the things you
care about safe #prepareactsurvive  https://t.co/2msiIbbVxq 

Read more about the campaign here: https://t.co/SZlHG3xBnL

Did you catch @stewart_mounsey our Area Flood & Coastal Risk Manager talking about #FloodActionWeek on @BBC_Cumbria earlier? 

If you missed it, you can catch up here üëâ https://t.co/wWULohixHP

In the meantime here's Stewart explaining how you can & why you should get involved https://t.co/sUxzt2bCDJ
We‚Äôre pleased to support the @EnvAgency‚Äôs #FloodActionWeek, promoting the steps we can all take to reduce the risk of flooding https://t.co/NceTv0dYAN

Very excited to have joined my first virtual ribbon cutting ceremony last week to celebrate the completion of the dynamic new river channel in the heart of #StokeOnTrent.

Congratulations #TeamEA and partners! https://t.co/TuLIzg8dUD

We're planning a virtual public event for the Naburn community to let them know more about Property Flood Resilience (PFR) to help reduce their flood risk. 

You can help us by taking part in a survey to make the event useful https://t.co/OgHd2hDHei

#prepareactsurvive #York https://t.co/2JUiRpSyum

One year on from the South Yorkshire #floods, we're working to repair and improve #flood defences in the area to reduce flood risk this winter and beyond. Piling works have started in the village of #Fishlake, #Doncaster as part of our ¬£12m recovery works: https://t.co/Zqt4pI1Jx1 https://t.co/oJWTUC8EhT

We are delighted to be supporting the @EnvAgency 's #FloodActionWeek which starts today! 

We will be sharing a variety of useful resources throughout the week so you know how to prepare and respond to a flood. https://t.co/wRKOG2YNwS

Did you know. 5.2 million homes and businesses in England are at risk of flooding.

 Are you one of them? Do you know? Don‚Äôt assume it‚Äôs not you.

Check your flood risk for your home or work at: https://t.co/29saU23JrY #prepareactsurvive #FloodActionWeek üè†üåä https://t.co/SK5js60fkd

tweets.text:
The 2nd reading of Sewage (Inland Waters) Bill will now take place on the 15 Jan, as parliamentary time is being understandably devoted to COVID19. 

This just gives you more time to get in touch with your MP and demand they pipe up for rivers on the 15th January üëä https://t.co/PxJlZhCQGF
@Tamazi19 Hello - please report this to our national incident team on: 0800 80 70 60 - they will be able to ask more questions to log this as an incident - Eileen

Our Yorkshire Area Director Oliver Harmar recalls witnessing the devastating flooding in South Yorkshire a year ago; outlines work that has been done since; and flood risk management plans in @yorkshirepost. https://t.co/I6eN2bcr8M https://t.co/cjBhjiNQrl
